Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Prophylactic Inotropic Agents in Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved individual participant randomisation.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults undergoing cardiac surgery without LCOS signs.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive inotropic agents or control (standard care, placebo, or other inotropes).

Objective.evidence: This trial assesses the prophylactic use of inotropic agents to prevent LCOS in adults undergoing cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was LCOS incidence within 48 hours post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 3307 participants were randomised: 1654 to the intervention and 1653 to the control group, recruited between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 1620 in the intervention and 1625 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Levosimendan reduced LCOS risk (RR 0.43, 95% CI 0.25 to 0.74) and mortality (RR 0.65, 95% CI 0.43 to 0.97).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, with no significant differences in cardiogenic shock, atrial fibrillation, or myocardial infarction.
